sequence:
A Knight's Promise

<size=45>Chapter 6 - A Vow of Pride</size>

scripts.say: Port - Office
U-556 balled up in her chair, burying her head in her knees.
The silence dragged on for what seemed like forever, until she finally spoke up.
You know, don't you, Commander? I told you before, Bismarck and I made a "Promise."
No matter where she is: on the water, under water, on land, or in the air, I swore to protect her from anything that tries to hurt her.
But like, isn't that kind of a crazy promise? A submarine is gonna protect a battleship? How is that supposed to work...? Ahaha.
I just keep using the promise as an excuse to go bother Lord Bismarck every day...
I'm a pain in the ass.

Whatever. Lord Bismarck is always telling us to change our bad habits. I'll just have to work that much harder on my missions. I mean of course, if Bismarck ever needed it I'd be there to help. I'd like to take some of the pressure off her.
No... I'm the one who should apologize.
Lord Bismarck? Why are you here?
I've actually been here for quite a while. I was worried about you. It seems my words may have troubled you, and for that I apologize.
No, no, you didn't do anything wrong. It's my fault for being such a brat and bothering you all the time.
That's not true. I have never thought you were a bother, U-556.

In fact, I've always loved spending time with you. When we're together, I feel the burden of leadership lifted from my shoulders. For that short time, I get to relish the pleasure of chatting with a dear friend.
I'd say your playfulness, your purity, and even your joy rubs off on me, U-556.
Lord Bismarck...
To be honest, I never thought you would so bravely come dashing to my rescue, just to fulfill some jokey little promise from way back when...
You are no bothersome child. You are a loyal knight who stands by her words, second to none, and worthy of respect. I am ashamed to admit I did not see that before. I am sorry.
Bismarck suddenly stood up ramrod straight and loudly cleared her throat.
U-556! On the honor of the Parzival name, and before Neptune, lord of the seas, do you swear:
That you will provide any assistance to me in a time of need, no matter where I may be, even at risk to your own life and limb?
U-556 sat in stunned silence until a glittering smile flashed across her face.
Yes! I swear anywhere, anytime, from any threat, U-556 will protect you!
